title: What's keeping Moonflair Spellblade off of Summoner's Rift?
body:
I always wondered what kept Moonflair off of the Rift. Is it a balance issue, map exclusivity, or something else?

I'd love to see it on champs like Diana and Amumu.

EDIT : Loving the discussion here, people. I've asked another question pertaining to nerfing it slightly like increasing the cost to something deserving of its stats or removing its tenacity, was wondering what you guys though about that? I see a lot of discussion about balance (obviously, it's a GREAT item), but not much about what would happen to champions or how it would affect the itemization of AP bruisers and others who found use for the item.

replies.body:
Two things on the itemization:

1. Tenacity is largely a bruiser stat. It can be good on mages who also buy Zhonya's, but that's basically it. Squishies who get hit by CC tend to die to them anyway, even if it's .5 seconds shorter. Tanks don't really care about being stunned. So it's only for "I want high damage uptime and I have a fair bit of health."
2. Armor+MR is not generally a good set of stats to have on an item. We have a stat for "makes you more durable against all incoming damage" and that stat in Health. Very rarely do Armor and MR exist on the same item. I can't speak to the reasons for why they do.

Overall, you do properly identify that Amumu/Diana want the item. Singed does too. It's something I can ask about, more durability+AP for the melee mage/bruiser types.

First off, I'd like to thank you and all the reds for the attention. I'm glad you guys were so willing to discuss something that's I've been interested in fior such a long time.

I'm a fan of AP bruisers because some reason the way they do damage fascinates me (I remember calling them lovetaps for the longest), and I realize how drastically the game could change putting Moonflair on the Rift. Bans of AP bruisers like Singed and Amumu and Diana (my worst fear, Diana being a permaban) would spike.

Buuuuut I can also see super-annoying champs like Kassadin building this and buffing their durability a whole bunch. An even tankier multiflashing assassin that's almost uncatchable scares me more than what would become of actual bruisers.

The possibilities I see with this item are amazing. Kinda wanna see them on the PBE, even if it requires minor nerfs for a little more balance (cost increase, ect.) I could see it becoming a staple item on a lot of champs.

Swain, Elise, Lissandra, Nunu, Annie, etc. A lot of Champions could use it.

Of course, is it a MUST that they get it? No, that's up to the player.

> Overall, you do properly identify that Amumu/Diana want the item. Singed does too. It's something I can ask about, more durability+AP for the melee mage/bruiser types.

There are a few other champions that could massively benefit from this item as well though. Rumble would see a resurgence if this item was available considering his semi-melee spell range and his melee autos. I could see it as a potential pickup on Vladimir or Mordekaiser as well, both of whom tend to build slightly more tanky because of their short range spells or lack of CC and their need for more sustained battles. Even Kassadin or Gragas could probably make solid use of it.

I'd be a bit worried about a few outlying cases though. I could see the potential for abuse on supports with this item; almost every single support could massively abuse this item unless its cost was so high that it really prohibited their purchasing it until very late in the game. Could be an issue with a few other champions as well, like Warwick or Nidalee.

this is what I would like to see as well, magic damage unlike physical is entirely based on the use of your skills, for the most part with some obvious exceptions, which makes you want to get some if not a lot of magic penetration to make sure you do as much damage as you possibly can. Sorcerer's boots are the fastest built and one of the few sources of flat magic penetration in the game which makes it a priority item for most mages, be they melee or ranged.

for Melee mages however tenacity can be just as sought after depending on your enemy's composition. While physical/Attack damage champions have their own source of tenacity with zephyr and merc treads, since they deal their damage with auto attacks for the most part which happen multiple times over the course of a few seconds unlike most mage abilities, they have the luxury of picking up these items without a major impact to their builds. Mages don't have that luxury, it is either a choice between tenacity from merc treads at the sacrifice of precious magic penetration or the other way around. Not all mages benefit greatly from zhonyas and its stasis which leaves them at a disadvantage compared to their physical damage counterparts.

I wonder if there are AP bruiser champions who effectively operate as such (c'mon, Diana's played most effectively as an assassin right now). It's an interesting question but if Diana or Amumu built these things does that mean they can opt out of merc treads and go potentially even more threatening? Does it create more player expression or does it make the big fat bullies even bigger, fatter bullies? I think it comes to the fact that spellcasts are inherently bursty, so when you create tenacity AP items there's risk of creating an item that allows the burst-spellcasty bullies to get even further ahead in the snowball.

The item already exists on Crystal Scar though, and as far as I know doesn't cause any huge problems there. Do you feel there's something unique to Crystal Scar that prevents abuse there but would prove broken on Summoner's Rift?

Correct, but keep in mind AP characters have traditionally suffered heavily on Dominion and so AP itemization as a whole was buffed quite a bit to support them. We've seen this manifest with the extremely powerful hextech sweeper, Blackfire torch variants, and wooglet's which combines DC and Zhonya's. 

I think it's safe to say that if we just gave +25% AP to Zhonya's on SR it would certainly cause problems, so in general it's not wise to assume that just because an item isn't causing huge problems on one map doesn't mean it won't on another. 

We've also seen the inverse of this which is why a handful of items are pulled from each map (warmog's is removed from TT for example). These removals are generally only done in the case of extreme imbalances and can (and have) warped map balance heavily in the past. We need to be really cautious when porting items between maps and game modes.

Actually, AP mages tend to be extremely powerful on Dominion even without Wooglets.
Their strength peaked in S3 due to certain items and mastery changes, but they are still an extremely powerful and dominant class in Dominion at upper echelons of play.

The reason Wooglets isnt abusive in Dominion is because the passive gold and experience gain mean people can run around and teamfight instead of having to sit in a lane in order to remain relevant, and thus not only do teamfights happen a lot more frequently, enemy tanks/bruisers tend to be a lot tankier on the whole due to having more gold to throw at defensive items (its very common to see tanks/bruisers with at least 100-150 MR at the 10 minute mark)

This results in Void Staff and Blackfire Torch becoming the primary offensive items for a lot of mages, and those that don't go for Blackfires tend to grab an Athenes or Morellos for the CDR so that they have their ultimates up for more fights (since in Dominion usually you don't have the option of simply waiting for important long cooldowns to be up before fighting, CDR is a much more valuable stat; the lack of "free" CDR from Blue also helps contributes to this)
What's stopping you guys from sticking it on SR in the PBE and seeing the effects?

If memory serves me correctly, I'm pretty certain we used to call that Zhonya's Ring. ;) just sayin.

Honestly, I don't know why you went through the trouble of making witchcap when you coulda just brought zhonya's ring back. Or did you do so in order to avoid confusion because the community uses the short-hand "zhonya's" to refer to zhonya's hourglass now?

Witchcap was originally Deathcap + %MS; they later converted it to a Zhonya's Ring clone for reasons nobody really understands but which are appreciated by people who can't be bothered to think about their build and rush it.

Remember Zhonya's Ring? where it was high AP with deathcap's passive, armour, and hourglass active, the item was separated into death hat and hour rock to separate the offense and defense- flash forward and you gave hourglass offense and defense while nerfing death hat's offense which makes hourglass very overpowered flash forward a little bit more and you get a renamed and reskined Z.Ring with witchcap on TT

Dunno, the exclusion of Thornmail e.g. means you either have to counterpick Tryn or ban him - as there´s not much you can do with itemization in TTT. I  really think limiting itemization too much does actually hurt the game - like leaving mercs as the only viable choice for tenacity...the stat is way to important currently to keep long duration cc like morgs cage in check, but it offers no real choices in itemization and therefor is very unsatisfying/boring (in no way do i want some overboard item-salad like Dota has, but heavily specialized items like thornmail and aegis that can keep certain champs at bay if they snowball at the cost of being eventually more vulnerable to their teammates are in my opinion a lot more interessting than the standard IE you´ll just get because you need it for lategame dps).

There is yes. Specifically the duration and relative power of champions. There is also a better IE on crystal scar and many other different items which serve to correct what otherwise would be imbalances in champion choice. 

Moonflair Spellblade in SR would be hilariously OP
Personally speaking, I just want another option other than Zhonya's sometimes...that option of course, being a viable alternative to Zhonya's.

>I think it comes to the fact that spellcasts are inherently bursty, so when you create tenacity AP items there's risk of creating an item that allows the burst-spellcasty bullies to get even further ahead in the snowball.

But at the end of the day could really be any worse on impact of AP champions than {{item:3157}} for such cases?
One omits you from doing actions, one just lets you do more actions as the enemy team tries to shut you down.

> One omits you from doing actions, one just lets you do more actions as the enemy team tries to shut you down.

Honestly, if you're a bursty caster, and being targetted by CC, you're already in a bad place.  Moonflair doesn't give the other stat Merc Treads provides:  magic resistance.
To me, MR is far more important, since for most team fight situations, if you get hit by one CC, you're going to die, whether you have tenacity or not.  Tenacity is more of a tank stat - since you can actually survive the burst of 2-3 players.
The only time I'm tempted to build tenacity as a mage is when there's a silence on the enemy team,  since getting silenced is less deadly than getting stunned, but still important to get out of early.

Also, when playing assassins, I note that I rarely care about the duration of CC, because assassins are generally very binary.  You go in and either use all your abilities, or get hit by a CC.  If you get CC'd, you're dead unless the target is alone, in which case you have a chance.  And .25 seconds less CC isn't going to change the 1v1, nor save you in the dive in (unlike Zhonya's, which lasts long enough for your abilities to come off c/d).

Moonflair does give MR, though. It's 50 AP, 50 Armor and 50 MR. It's pretty friggin good.

With tenacity it basically nullifies the need for Merc Treads. You're MUCH better off buying Sorc shoes (assuming you're AP).

I really don´t see that happening...it doesn´t offer much offensive power, so a burst-caster really has a heavy tradeoff if he decides to go moonflair (and if it´s still too much you could always lower the ap). 
SR really lacks itemization-choices in regard to tenacity, on 99%of the champions it´s either mercs or stay in morgs cage for  long enough to rebuild the cathedral of notredam in original size with matchsticks.

Isn't lacking itemization a reason for the lack of ap-bruisers?
there is only one armor/ap option that isn't optimal for bruisers(ok, ad is even more lacking here...), there is only one viable ap+mr option that would go very well with sorc-boots, makeing mercs(the only tenacity item) less appealing, there is no realy great option for healthm rylais is overall a bit lacking, and RoA is a bunch of stacks needing to stack up, delaying ur power to long for toplane.
Moonflair would be a nice option of costefficient power, especially building out of seekers, so u can stand vs ad-bruisers wich usually have a huge advantage in the early laneing, as they have easy acces to sustain(lifesteal, and healthregen for hydra) and a very costefficient ad+mr item with hextrinker.

However, i think the mainreason for the lack of ap-bruisers is the lack of mana. If u got a bruiser path instead of assasin on a champ like fizz or diana, u need way more spellrotations as u lacj burst, and u would want max-cdr, wich means u need incredible much mana on them.
However, with the mr-nerf on athenes there is no real sustain option for ap-bruisers, and pure max-mana isn't that great, there is a reason why Athenes is heavilly favored over AA+RoA.
U could ad a  managain on-hit to moonflare and evt some as(a dagger in the builtpath and +20%as on moonflare), wich would fit the 'Blade' theme, profit most ap-bruisers, as most ap-bruiseres have some form of as-scaling, and it would reduce the cost-efficeny of the tank+burst stats by increasing the total costs without incresing tankiness or burst gained.

I also don't belife tenacity would be to problematic on burst-heavy champs, as they usually don't gain much more dmg from lower CC-duration unless there spells come off cd while CCed.
If a diana goes in with Q+R, she has no acces to her major burst for the next 3.6-5sec, so beeing cced in that time won't cost her to much damage compared to a Jax or Vi

Rumble, also Singed, Rammus. Not only Ap bruisers but also Ap tanks would like that. Mostly as some other option for Tenacity. After SotAG rework there are on SR only two tenacity items - Zephyr for autoattackers and Mercs for everyone else.
But see, the main reason I want to buy MFSB is because I want the armor, mr, ap; rather than the tenacity. Because presently, there is precious little itemization for both mr and armor.
Bruiser mains would scream AP favoritism because they get an item with AP, MR, Armor, and Tenacity

So? Quite a few of those bruisers can also use the same darn item effectively. Shyvana would get 30 extra damage on her E and ult, it also lets her either grab swifties for better stickiness or tabi if they've got somebody like Vayne around. Renekton would get an extra 5 damage per second on his ult. Diana could actually build as a bruiser if she can get that and tabi. Vi gets another 35 damage on her E, and can get more boot options. AD Nidalee would absolutely LOVE the item, much needed resists and tenacity and a little bit of AP for when in human form. Rengar's W gets a boost. Jax is Jax and can use anything. Mundo goes were he pleases, and gets an extra 10 damage on W. Irelia gets an extra 25 damage on E and per ult blade. Not to mention Galio would also LOVE the item (75 AP for him). Its an extra 50 damage on Fiora's Riposte. Also a great item for Xin Zhao, improves both his self heal passive from W and his E damage. Even Yasuo can make use of it, to say nothing of it also being usable for Tryndamere and Trundle.

Honestly the only people it would be less than desirable for are pure AD assassins like Zed, about half the ADCs, and some hyper aggressive fighters like Riven. Or a couple tanky fighters with very basic kits like Darius and Garen.

I disagree. Having AP ratios and wanting to buy AP are entirely different. The build takes 870 gold worth of amp tomes. For the bruisers you mentioned, that much gold is going into maybe a hundred damage over the course of the fight? That doesn't even come close to being worthwhile.

Mind you, with how much AP bruisers benefit from Sorc shoes, I'm not opposed to giving them another source of tenacity. Just want to point out that I can't see any of those bruisers you mentioned using the thing. (Except Jax, of course, but he's ridiculous.)

This was something i've heard about a possible "Moonfire cape" where Rioters said it will just unbalance everything, since you would take the three best tank stats by just buying two items. With moonflair i guess it should be quite similar. You have already GA as the item with MR and Armor in SR, plus the passive, if you had also moonflair, not only you would be adding a huge advantage to AP tanky champions compared to non-AP ones, but also making less important other items, etc.. So i guess it's all about balance.

That said, I WOULD LOVE TO HAVE MOONFLAIR ON SR, i was just sharing my thoughts on why it's not there. Greetings

Thanks for the reply. We're totes on the same page, but I think that an extra life vs. AP and tenacity is more of a role thing.

Bruisers would go for the damage. Carries who can't bother with defense and who need saving would get the extra life.

Imagine the spike you're adding to Maokai, Nautilus, Rammus, etc.. all the utility junglers that now have also quil coat (hopefully buffed soon, cause it's unfinished imo). You have to think about it before you add an item that has tenacity, plus 50 ap, 50 MR and 50 Armor. I mean, just imagine the cost efficiency of Moonflair plus Sunfire to all these champions that now are "OK" or "a bit behind", becoming fucking monsters, unkillable AND doing really nice damage ALSO.
As i said, i would love to see it, but maybe it would break the balance really hard ;)

> I always wondered what kept Moonflair off of the Rift. Is it a balance issue, map exclusivity, or something else?
> 
> I'd love to see it on champs like Diana and Amumu.

It used to be purchasable on the rift then riot removed it for some reason.  I think a version of it could make it back there if you are fine with different stats for it.  My biggest issue is it has a lot of stats and it's a strictly better version of GA for most champs.  I'm not going to lie, the GA passive is rarely helpful as is.

AGES ago people complained about not enough tenacity items, so Riot added one for each class:
Mercury's Treads was for tanks, then they added Eleisa's Miracle for Supports, Cloak and Dagger for basic-attack-reliant champions and Moonflair Spellblade for mages.   the problem was, they all sucked really hard.

Moonflair was basically a blasting wand with tenacity. Cloak and Dagger was half a phantom dancer and eleisa's miracle was a big philosopher's stone... and they all wasted an entire item slot.   They were basically removed because they were trap purchases SO under-tuned that it almost worthless to even allow them to be options.

So here's my question to really anyone at Riot:  If {{item:3170}}  is over-tuned so that it can exist on twisted treeline where mages need help, same as {{item:3090}} , then what prevents a less powerful version of it from gracing the fields of justice on Summoner's Rift?   

I mean, {{item:3157}} is undoubtedly inferior to Wooglet's, but, in exchange for weaker stats, it is balanced to be on the rift.

OBVIOUSLY one of the primary problems with Moonflair is the presence of high MR and armour on a heavy AP item with tenacity, but what stops a less all-around amazing defensive pick, (maybe, say, {{item:3191}}  + {{item:3113}} ) from being allowed on the Rift so that AP fighters like {{champion:27}} ,{{champion:13}} ,{{champion:28}} ,{{champion:68}} ,{{champion:8}} , etc. can enjoy the same tenacity that their AD counterparts get to help them do their jobs? (though, obviously singed and ryze would prefer mana, that would be overtuned with a glacial shroud, methinks, and rumble and vlad would hate it.

Likewise, while I think the new {{item:3207}} is amazing, I really miss the ability to play a tank that needs to stick, like Sejuani, and run both tenacity and {{item:3009}} .   Perhaps add in a remake to force of nature that has stats similar to the old SotAG with, maybe a {{item:3114}} and a {{item:1011}} so that sticky non AD, non AP tanks that really need to stick can opt into tenacity without being shoehorned (no pun intended) into {{item:3111}} ?

Generally speaking, the items in alternate maps exist to help out classes that are struggling more there than they are in Rift.

In Dominion and Treelines - duelists and skirmishers reign supreeme, and team-fighters and those reliant on a front line tend to...not. Mages and Marksman needed an extra push, so mages got Blackfire Torch (most broken item ever), Wogglet's Witchap, and Moonflair spellblade.
I'm not sure exactly why Moonflare got it's ranged-exclusive portion removed there though - Singed is an incredibly dominant pick in treelines.
Marksman got an easier build path to Infinity Edge with Wicket, though they're still struggling pretty hard in both modes.

For Abyss, it's team-fighters and heavy poke that tends to win, so (basically melee champs) got Orb of Winter and the warhorn.


Anyways - adding those items into Rift would pretty much come with a guarantee they'd be broken in Rift due to their entire purpose largely being buffing an entire archetype to compete with the vastly different environment of other maps and modes.
This item would be straight god-like on Gragas. Just grab this bad boy after your Rod of Ages and you'll be unstoppably tanky.

Just imagine how unkillable actual tanks could be. But that whole thing is expensive anyway, AP items cost a lot of Gold, and if someone gets that fed they deserve the stats. 

What really disturbs be is that people will undoubtedly build both Moonflair and Zhonya's. The extra tankiness AND the active would probably turn into cancer.

I still think it's fixable, though.

The problem is that it's TOO stat efficient for one item.

Tenacity for mages/tanks would not be hard to implement on the rift, but it wouldn't be able to come in moonflair's form.

And, honestly, I think that most people requesting the item just want the tenacity option, not necessarily the bloated stats.

{{item:3170}} 's {{item:3191}} is fine, but combining it with heavy AP AND MR in one slot is a bit overwhelming.  {{item:3113}} is a much simpler option that would give the item clear identity as a slippery-mage item, without giving tonnes of unnecessary bonus stats to bloat the value of the item, and make it overtuned for the rift.

Tanks would, likely, not find the new item tanky enough though, so they'd probably want their own.  {{item:3207}} used to fill that niche, so, I think the best way to bring it back would be to make  VERY statistically similar item for tanks.... something like {{item:1011}}  + {{item:3114}}  as that will give tanks the CDR, HP and Mana regen that the old SotAG used to have.  Adding som %movespeed to  replace the bons damage and gold to jungle monsters wouldn't be frowned upon either.

Dunno if this will necro the thread or not, but I totally forgot Morello existed.

Hey, Morello! I'd love to know what you had to say about this!

My whole issue with the thing is that you get ar mr and hp on the same item.  not to mention ap and tenacity.  It is just too many types of stats in one place while being cost and slot efficient.  There is no reason to not buy it.  
But more importantly, I hate the ar and mr on the same item part.  With the exception of GA and warmogs, buying defensive items is a choice between ar and mr, followed by a choice of what do you want to go with your resist.  I think this choice is healthy for the game and I am opposed to giving out both on one item.  I have mixed feelings on GA, but I consider it ok because it is clearly bad as an item when the extra life is on cd, aka it has a clearly defined weakness (but possibly needs a slight nerf anyway).   There is no such weakness on Spellblade.  It is an amazing item all the time.  Quite frankly, I could see this item being must rush and making champs that are not effective with it not viable in mid and top.

I always thought that if it DID appear on SR the cost would be about 3000.

That way, the champs that rushed it were more akin to those that rushed a Bloodthirster or Rabadon's in lane, sacrificing a stat for what could make them viable later in the game.

If you rush a super expensive item, you're sacrificing either defense or offense, and the opponent can capitalize on that. Counterplay is allowed with cost increases, because you're given time to predict to and react to what your enemy is building. Someone who builds a Seeker's Armguard in lane can be taken advantage of regardless of what they were building. The wait time getting then gold necessary to complete the item makes it a little more balanced.

Or so I think. I could be entirely wrong, but a 3000G Moonflair Spellblade is something I want to see on the PBE, just for results.
